bibl.idno: Papers of Jefferson Randolph Kean [manuscript] / Jefferson Randolph Kean, 1860-1950. MSS 628. The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va.

bibl.title: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Jefferson Randolph Kean, September 23, 1942

div1.p: Kellogg acknowledges receipt of Kean's letter and writes about a common acquaintance. He includes another letter he wrote to the Keans in the morning. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Jefferson Randolph Kean, September 23, 1942
div1.opener:
GEORGE A. KELLOGG
41 EAST 42ND STREET
NEW YORK,N.Y.
Wednesday afternoon,
Dear General Kean,
div1.p:
Your letter arrived just
as I was about to send the
one I wrote this morning.

I held up the snap shots
because I was waiting for the
enlargements enclosed.

I enjoyed your remarks about
the rose situation and will put
your advise to good use.

Col. Edgar E. Hume just left my
office and we had quite a
conversation about you.

You will hear from me
shortly.
